instruction: Wash the basmati or Jeerakasala rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
title: Soak the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Now we are going to prepare Malabar style chicken biriyani. Let's see how to make it. Take 1 kg chicken cut into big pieces. Add salt, 2 tsp lemon juice, half of a small lemon, ¼ tsp turmeric powder, and 1 tsp chilli powder. Mix it well and keep it aside.
[unintelligible]

instruction: Boil water in a large pot, add salt and whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf). Add soaked rice and cook until it is 90% done. Drain the rice and set it aside.
title: Cook the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 tsp fennel seeds, 1 tsp cashew nuts, a small piece of cinnamon, ½ tsp cloves, 1 bay leaf, 1 clove, and 10 cardamoms.
Add 1.5 tsp turmeric powder, 1.5 tsp cumin powder, and 2 tsp chilli powder.
Now add the marinated chicken.

Marinate for just 15 minutes since we didn’t add ginger and garlic, so it doesn’t need long marination. Add one big tomato directly with the chicken (no need to sauté with onion). Add ¼ cup curd and mix well. The curd softens the chicken, and we already added lemon juice earlier.
Add some salt and some coriander leaves.
Add plenty of fresh mint leaves — make sure they are nice and fresh for better flavor.

The chicken is cooked well. Don’t cook it on high flame — use medium flame. Add 1.25 cups of coconut milk and mix. Cook for 5 more minutes and set aside. It shouldn’t be too dry; some gravy is needed. The chicken masala is ready. Now we will prepare ghee rice using basmati rice.
Heat 3 tbsp ghee. Add 1 tsp fennel seeds, 1 tsp pepper, 8 cardamoms, 1 tbsp tomato, 1 tbsp cashew nut powder, and 1 tbsp curry leaves.
Add another 1 tbsp curry leaves, 1 tsp of shallots, 6 large shallots, and 4 tbsp washed tamarind.
[unintelligible]

Add 1 tbsp salt, mix well, and close the lid. When the rice is half cooked, stir it and close again. Once it is cooked, set it aside. We’ll cook it for 10 more minutes while “dumming.” For garnishing, add ghee in a pan and roast the raisins.
Add cashew nuts and fry well. Then add onion and fry. In a big vessel, layer the chicken masala and add the cooked rice on top.
